item.title: Upgrading phpMyAdmin (2.7.0-pl2 to 2.8.1) on a local, Windows-based, Apache server
item.description: In this guide, we'll be upgrading phpMyAdmin 2.7.0-pl2 to 2.8.1, on a Windows machine, running Apache 1.x.

item.title: Installing MySQL and phpMyAdmin on a local Windows-based, Apache, server
item.description: MySQL will allow us to create databases on our local server. With PHP, this will allow us to install applications like the free WordPress, as well as number of open source content management systems, not to mention bulletin boards and the like. phpMyAdmin will allow us to administer MySQL quite easily.
